_header: Of greater cause may no wight him complain
Subjects: lovers, addresses to beloved; complaints, lovers’; lover’s plea
_description: ‘Complaint to my Lodesterre’, once thought to be by Chaucer — seven stanzas rhyme royal

BLHar7578.First Lines:
[O]f gretter cause may no wight him compleyneThan y for loue hath
                    ne sette in swiche case…
BLHar7578.Last Lines:
…Right so harde I a maan so piteously groneAnd to him selfe
                    right thus he made his mone
BLHar7578.Note:
Initial ‘O’ is missing, with space left for illuminated
                    initial.
